bid.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: the person who places the highest bid
We’ve made a bid of nearly £400 million for the company.
A takeover bid for the airline was launched today.
They put in a bid for the house.
bid.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: an offer to do work or provide services for a specific price
bid.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: rival bids for the cleaning contract
bid.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: an attempt to achieve or obtain something
bid.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: a desperate bid to free herself from a loveless marriage
bid.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: a statement of how many points you hope to win in a card game

bid.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: Three firms bid for the contract on the new buildings.
bid.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to say how many points you think you will win in a game of cards
bid.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: to order or tell someone what to do
